metadata.title: CVE-2019-12212 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
When FreeImage 3.18.0 reads a special JXR file, the StreamCalcIFDSizefunction of JXRMeta.c repeatedly calls itself due to improper processing ofthe file, eventually causing stack exhaustion. An attacker can achieve aremote denial of service attack by sending a specially constructed file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12212` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libfreeimage3 - 3.17.0+ds1-2ubuntu0.1+esm1
libfreeimageplus3 - 3.17.0+ds1-2ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: freeimage package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.17.0+ds1-2ubuntu0.1+esm1').
